dublinCore.dc:title: 113 HR 481 IH: To direct the Secretary of Veterans Affairs to accept certain documents as proof of service in determining the eligibility of an individual to receive amounts from the Filipino Veterans Equity Compensation Fund, and for other purposes.
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Heck of Nevada introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Veterans’ Affairs

form.official-title: To direct the Secretary of Veterans Affairs to accept certain documents as proof of service in determining the eligibility of an individual to receive amounts from the Filipino Veterans Equity Compensation Fund, and for other purposes.

section.header: Proof of eligibility for Filipino Veterans Equity Compensation Fund

subsection.text: Section 1002 of the American Recovery and Reinvestment Act of 2009 (division A of Public Law 111–5; 38 U.S.C. 107 note) is amended by adding at the end the following new subsections:

paragraph.text: The Secretary shall accept as proof of the service described in subsection (d) or (n)—

subparagraph.text: documents included in the claims folder of the eligible person that prove such service, including an affidavit from the government of the Philippines certifying such service (AGO Form 23); or
any other documents that are issued or accepted by the government of the Philippines as proof of such service.

paragraph.text: The Secretary may not reject a document under paragraph (1) solely because the document is issued by the government of the Philippines.
In this subsection, the term government of the Philippines includes the Commonwealth of the Philippines, the Commonwealth Army of the Philippines, and the Republic of the Philippines.

subsection.text: Service as a civilian guerilla in the Philippines during the period described in paragraph (1) of subsection (d) shall be treated as service described under such subsection for purposes of a person being eligible for benefits under this section.
The Secretary of the Army shall cooperate with the Secretary of Veterans Affairs in carrying out this section.
Section 1002(c) of the American Recovery and Reinvestment Act of 2009 (division A of Public Law 111–5; 38 U.S.C. 107 note) is amended by adding at the end the following new paragraph:

paragraph.text: Notwithstanding paragraph (1), the Secretary may make a payment from the compensation fund to an eligible person who, during the 180-day period beginning on the date of the enactment of this section, submits to the Secretary—

subparagraph.text: a claim for benefits under this section; or
with respect to a person who filed a claim for benefits under this section during the period described in paragraph (1), a new claim or an appeal to such previously filed claim.
